en.innerHTML:
• Atoms that have the same number of protons but different numbers of neutrons are known as isotopes.
  • Isotopes have different atomic masses.
  • The relative abundance of an isotope is the percentage of atoms with a specific atomic mass found in a naturally occurring sample of an element.
  • The average atomic mass of an element is a weighted average calculated by multiplying the relative abundances of the element’s isotopes by their atomic masses and then summing the products.
  • The relative abundance of each isotope can be determined using mass spectrometry.
  • A mass spectrometer ionizes atoms and molecules with a high-energy electron beam and then deflects the ions through a magnetic field based on their mass-to-charge ratios (m/z)
  • The mass spectrum of a sample shows the relative abundances of the ions on the y-axis and their m/z ratios on the x-axis. if z = 1 for all ions, then the x-axis can instead be expressed in units of atomic mass (u)

  • Ii-Isotopes zinobunzima beathom obahlukeneyo.
  • Ubuninzi obunxulumene nesotopu yipesenti yeeathom ezinobunzima obuthile beathom obufunyenwe kwisampulu eyenzeka ngokwendalo yento.
  • Umndilili wobunzima beatom yento yiavareji enobunzima obalwayo ngokuphinda-phinda ubuninzi obuzalanayo bento eisotophu ngobunzima bazo zeatom kwaye emva koko ushwankathele iimveliso.
  • I-mass spectrometer yenza i-athom kunye neeathom kunye neeathom kunye ne-athom kunye ne-athomu ye-elektroni enamandla aphezulu kwaye ijike ii-ion kumhlaba wemagnethi ngokusekelwe kumlinganiselo wazo wokutshaja (m/z)

en.innerHTML: Everything is composed of atoms. These tiny building blocks of matter make up your computer or phone screen, the chair you’re sitting on, even your own body. If we could zoom in far enough, we’d see that atoms themselves are made up of even tinier components, which we call subatomic particles.
innerContent: Everything is composed of atoms. These tiny building blocks of matter make up your computer or phone screen, the chair you’re sitting on, even your own body. If we could zoom in far enough, we’d see that atoms themselves are made up of even tinier components, which we call subatomic particles.

xh.innerHTML: Yonke into yenziwe ngeeathom. Ezi zitena zincinci zokwakha zenza ikhompyuter yakho okanye isikrini sefowuni, isitulo ohleli kuso, kunye nomzimba wakho. Ukuba sinokusondeza kude ngokwaneleyo, sinokubona ukuba iiathom ngokwazo zenziwe ngezinto ezincinci, esizibiza ngokuba ngamasuntswana e-subatomic.

Ukuba sinokusondeza kude ngokwaneleyo, sinokubona ukuba iiathom ngokwazo zenziwe ngezinto ezincinci, esizibiza ngokuba ngamasuntswana e-subatomic.

en.innerHTML: There are three main types of subatomic particles in an atom: protons, neutrons, and electrons. A proton carries a 1+1+1, plus charge, an electron carries a 1-1−1, minus charge, and a neutron carries 000 charge. Protons and neutrons are found in the nucleus at the center of an atom, whereas electrons are found in orbitals that surround the nucleus. Since electrons are negatively charged, they are strongly attracted to the positively charged protons in the nucleus.

xh.innerHTML: Kukho iintlobo ezintathu eziphambili amasuntswana subatomic kwi atom: iiprotons, neutron, kunye electron. Iproton ithwala i-1+1+1, kunye nentlawulo, i-electron ithwala i-1-1−1, thabatha intlawulo, kwaye ineutron ithwala i-000 yentlawulo. Iiprotoni kunye ne-neutron zifumaneka kwinucleus esembindini we-athomu, kanti ii-electron zifumaneka kwii-orbitals ezingqonge i-nucleus. Ekubeni ii-electron zihlawuliswa kakubi, zitsalwa kakhulu kwiiprotons ezichajiwe kakuhle kwi-nucleus.

en.innerHTML: According to the diagram, this helium atom contains two protons, two neutrons, and two electrons. The numbers of protons and electrons make sense: the atomic number of helium is 222, so any helium atom must have two protons in its nucleus (otherwise, it would be an atom of a different element!). And, because this is a neutral atom, it must contain two electrons to balance out the positive charge from the nucleus. But what about the number of neutrons? Do all helium atoms have two neutrons in their nuclei?

xh.innerHTML: Ngokomzobo, le athom ye-helium iqulethe iiprotoni ezimbini, i-neutron ezimbini, kunye nee-electron ezimbini. Amanani eeproton kunye nee-electron anengqiqo: inani le-athomu ye-helium yi-222, ngoko ke nayiphi na i-athomu ye-helium kufuneka ibe neeprotoni ezimbini kwi-nucleus yayo (kungenjalo, ibiya kuba yi-athomu yento eyahlukileyo!). Kwaye, ngenxa yokuba le i-athomu engathathi hlangothi, kufuneka iqulathe ii-electron ezimbini ukulinganisa intlawulo elungileyo evela kwinucleus. Kodwa kuthekani ngenani leeneutron? Ngaba zonke iiathom zeheliyamu zineenyutroni ezimbini kwiinuclei zazo?

Kwaye, ngenxa yokuba le i-athomu engathathi hlangothi, kufuneka iqulathe ii-electron ezimbini ukulinganisa intlawulo elungileyo evela kwinucleus. Kodwa kuthekani ngenani leeneutron? Ngaba zonke iiathom zeheliyamu zineenyutroni ezimbini kwiinuclei zazo?

en.innerHTML: As it turns out, they don’t! We know that atoms with different numbers of protons in their nuclei are different elements. The same is not true when it comes to neutrons, though: atoms of the same element can contain different numbers of neutrons in their nuclei and still retain their identity. Such atoms are known as isotopes, and a single element can have many different isotopes.
innerContent: As it turns out, they don’t! We know that atoms with different numbers of protons in their nuclei are different elements. The same is not true when it comes to neutrons, though: atoms of the same element can contain different numbers of neutrons in their nuclei and still retain their identity. Such atoms are known as isotopes, and a single element can have many different isotopes.

xh.innerHTML: Njengoko kuvela, abakwenzi! Siyazi ukuba iiathom ezinamanani ahlukeneyo eeprotons kwinuclei yazo zizinto ezahlukeneyo. Okufanayo akuyonyani xa kufikwa kwi-neutron, nangona: iiathomu zesiqalelo esifanayo zinokuqulatha amanani ahlukeneyo eenyutroni kwiinuclei zazo kwaye zigcine ubuni bazo. Iiathom ezinjalo zaziwa ngokuba zii-isotopi, kwaye into enye inokuba nee-isotopi ezininzi ezahlukeneyo.

Iiathom ezinjalo zaziwa ngokuba zii-isotopi, kwaye into enye inokuba nee-isotopi ezininzi ezahlukeneyo.

en.innerHTML: The word isotope is derived from Ancient Greek: the prefix iso- means “same,” while -tope (from the Greek word topos) means “place.” The isotopes of a given element always contain the same number of protons and therefore occupy the same place on the periodic table. However, because isotopes contain different numbers of neutrons, each isotope has a unique atomic mass.

xh.innerHTML: Igama elithi isotope lithatyathwe kwisiGrike saMandulo: isimaphambili iso- sithetha “efanayo,” ngelixa -tope (elisuka kwigama lesiGrike elithi topos) lithetha “indawo.” Iisotopi zento enikiweyo zihlala zinenani elifanayo leeprotons kwaye ke zithatha indawo enye kwitafile yeperiodic. Nangona kunjalo, ngenxa yokuba ii-isotopu ziqulethe amanani ahlukeneyo e-neutron, isotopu nganye inobunzima be-athomu ekhethekileyo.
